Question.Subject: Do I need an ISP for wireless?
Question.Content: I have a desktop computer. I currently have a dial-up (Netzero) ISP. What exactly is wireless, how does it work and do I need ANY ISP to connect to the Internet? I know this question has been answered for laptops and for cable connections but I don't have either one. I'd like to do away with dial-up but my budget doesn't include cable of any kind. Can you just buy a router and do a one time shot kind of thing? Sorry, I'm really technically challenged.
Question.ChosenAnswer: you can not go wireless on dial up due to dial up is the slowest connection and the do not make wire routers for diaal up

Answer.Content: you can not go wireless on dial up due to dial up is the slowest connection and the do not make wire routers for diaal up
